content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

You can create the function `clean_column` in Julia as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[- ]" => "_")
end
```
This function first converts the input string to lower case and removes any leading or trailing white spaces using `strip`. Then, it replaces all hyphens `-` and spaces ` ` with underscores `_` by invoking the built-in function `replace` in Julia. The second argument of the replace function is a regular expression that matches either a space or a hyphen (`r"[- ]"`).
